New Records: Uruguay won the 2024 Copa America third-place playoff on penalties.
Canada came close to finishing third in the Copa America but were defeated by Uruguay in the penalty shootout.
Key Match Events: The match ended 2-2 in regulation time, leading to a penalty shootout.
Luis Suarez scored a stoppage-time equalizer for Uruguay, forcing the game into extra time.
Canada's Alphonso Davies missed a Panenka attempt in the penalty shootout, resulting in a Uruguay victory.
The penalty shootout itself was a key event in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Canada was expected to finish third in the Copa America, which they nearly achieved but fell short due to the late goal and penalty shootout outcome.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada was considered the better team during the match but were defeated by Uruguay's late goal and their ability to win the penalty shootout.
Uruguay's victory gave them the third-place finish in the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game included live updates, stoppage time, and VAR decisions affecting the outcome.
The financial implications of finishing third and fourth in the Copa America were mentioned.
